programme.title: USA-AUS - Women's Semi-Final | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Women's Semi-Final took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 09/08/24. The United States of America won this Game with a final score: USA 85:64 AUS.

programme.title: Can NBA and Dream Team star Laettner teach this team to win?
programme.desc: Team USA and NBA legend Christian Laettner shows the Garinger High School varsity basketball team how they can improve their game.

programme.title: SRB-GER - Men's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Bronze Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 10/08/2024. Serbia won the Bronze with a final score SRB 93:83 GER.

programme.title: BEL-AUS - Women's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Women's Bronze Medal Game took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 11/08/2024. Australia won Bronze with a final score AUS 85:81 BEL.

programme.title: The Golden Generation | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: How a once-in-a-generation Argentina men's basketball team, led by Manu Ginobili, brought down the USA “Dream Team” and won the gold at the Athens 2004 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Opening Ceremony | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Re-experience an Opening Ceremony for the ages, walking you through the history of the Host nation while celebrating Olympic Values in spectatcular fashion.

programme.title: The Olympic Series: The Olympic spirit : Redefining sport
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 4 : The Olympic spirit : Redefining sport.

programme.title: India’s Top Pistol Shooter Manu Bakher | Jee Jan Se
programme.desc: Throughout her childhood and teenage years, Manu Bakher switched sports half a dozen times. When she started practicing air pistol shooting, she knew this was the one for her. This is her amazing story.

programme.title: Shooting vs Cricket with Manu Bhaker and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: What happens in the battle of precision between cricket and shooting? The challenge is on, as Smriti Mandhana and Manu Bhaker swap the pistols and bats.

programme.title: 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This event took place on 27/07/2024 at the Chateauroux Shooting Range, Paris. CHN claimed the Gold, KOR the Silver and KAZ completed the podium.

programme.title: Hero of the Future: 15-year-old German Diving Prodigy
programme.desc: Lena Hentschel, 15, is a German High Diver and a big hope for her country in The Olympic Games 2020. Her motto is "no fun, no success."

programme.title: The future of Mexican diving belongs to this 15-year-old phenomenon
programme.desc: Randal Willars Valdez has a mission: first win gold at YOG 2018 in the 10m platform and then do the same Tokyo 2020.

programme.title: Molly Carlson, Canada’s Brave High Diver | Splash In
programme.desc: She started as a gymnast, then switched to diving, before specializing in high diving (20m) because that is what bravery is to her. Along the journey, she learned how to deal with mental health struggles, an experience that she now shares with her fans as a mental health advocate and founder of the #bravegang. Soundtrack: Bastille, Shut Off The Lights

programme.title: Melissa Wu, the Australian Olympic Diver Who Does Not Give Up | Splash In
programme.desc: At the age of 10 she knew that diving was the sport for her. Throughout her 16 years career, diving helped her overcome depression, anxiety, and lack of self-belief, until she won bronze in Tokyo 2020. Watch her story. Soundtrack: Bree Runway, Pressure.

programme.title: Ale: the Mexican diver trying to keep it all in synch | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Alejandra Orozco, two-time Olympic medallist in diving for Mexico, makes her fourth return to the Olympics at Paris 2024. More in sync than ever with her diving partner, Gabriela Agundez, and her family, she takes us back to where it all began: the family farm in the outskirt of Guadaljara. With the support of a loving family, hard work and dedication, she is hoping to reach the pinnacle of her career with Gold this Summer surrounded by her loved ones.

programme.title: Tom Daley: the long and bumpy road to Olympic gold | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Thirteen years after his Olympic debut, the British diver finally landed the gold medal that was missing from his collection.

programme.title: Matteo Zurloni Italy’s world champion climbs to the top | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Dive into the remarkable journey of Matteo Zurloni, from small town dreamer to Olympic contender. He won the speed event at the 2023 IFSC Climbing World Championships and earning a shot at Olympic glory. Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.title: Men's Individual Time Trial | Cycling Road | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Individual Time Trial took place at Pont Alexandre III on the 27/07/24. Remco Evenepoel (BEL) won the Gold Medal, Filippo Ganna (ITA) won the Silver Medal, and Wout Van Aert (BEL) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Attitude at altitude: Ethiopian cycling on the rise
programme.desc: The behind-closed-doors story of how Alen Girmay became the first winner of the Tour of Ethiopia.

programme.title: A family affair: The Eritrea cycling dynasty
programme.desc: Discover the reasons why cycling is the most popular sport in Eritrea and how the top riders become national heroes.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -48kg, Men's -60kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's -48kg and Men's -60kg Finals took place on 27/07/2024 at the Champs-de-Mars Arena. At the Women's -48kg, Natsumi Tsunoda (JPN) claimed the gold, Baasankhuu Bavuudorj (MGL) won silver, and the two bronze medals went to Tara Babulfath (SWE) and Shirine Boukli (FRA). At the Men's -60kg, Yeldos Smetov (KAZ) won the gold, Luka Mkheidze (FRA) took the silver, and the bronze went to Francisco Garrigos (ESP) and Ryuju Nagayama (JPN).

programme.title: How Majlinda Kelmendi’s historic Olympic medal put Kosovo on the map
programme.desc: Majlinda Kelmendi’s gold medal in Rio put Kosovo on top of the podium for the first time soon after being welcomed into the Olympic family.

programme.title: Athletes Under Fire - Episode 1: Yemen & Syria
programme.desc: Yemeni judo Olympian Ali Khousrof, and Syrian artistic gymnastics champion Ahmad Al Sawas, promote the power of sport in cities under siege.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Majlinda Kelmendi at age 19
programme.desc: With judo star Majlinda Kelmendi back home in Kosovo when she was 19.

programme.title: The secrets of DR Congo's cycling revolution
programme.desc: In a nation devastated by an active volcano and 20 years of permanent war, meet the young cyclists aiming for Olympic Games glory.

programme.title: Rafaela Silva at age 21
programme.desc: At home with judo star Rafaela Silva when she was 21.

programme.title: Women's Individual Time Trial | Cycling Road | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Individual Time Trial took place at Pont Alexandre III on the 27/07/24. Grace Brown (AUS) won the Gold Medal, Anna Henderson (GBR) won the Silver Medal, and Chloe Dygert (USA) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Italy’s Valentina Vezzali (extended)
programme.desc: Watch the extended version of Legends Live On featuring six-time gold medallist Valentina Vezzali whose domination in fencing earned her the nickname "Cobra."

programme.title: Where are they now? Valentina Vezzali’s legend lives on
programme.desc: Six-time Olympic gold medallist Valentina Vezzali dominated her sport and then went on to Italian Parliament. Now she’s training young fencers throughout the country.

programme.title: The taxi bike riders of Thousand Hills
programme.desc: The incredible tale of top Rwandan female cyclist Jeanne D'arc Girubuntu, and how she became a role model for young cyclists in her country.

programme.title: South African BMX stars are made in Velokhaya
programme.desc: How does the Velokhaya Life Cycling Academy creates champions - on and off South Africa's BMX tracks?

programme.title: Kenyan cycle legends in the making
programme.desc: "We can't just put a runner on a bike." How Kenya's cycle teams are trying to emulate the nation's sporting heroes.

programme.title: Men's Bronze Medal Match RSA - AUS | Rugby | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Rugby Bronze Medal Match between South Africa and Australia took place on 27/07/2024 at the Stade de France. South Africa took the Bronze with a Final Score of RSA 26:19 AUS.

programme.title: Men's Gold Medal Match FRA - FIJ | Rugby Sevens | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match between France and Fiji took place on 27/07/2024, at the Stade de France. France took the Gold with a Final Score FRA 28:7 FIJ.

programme.title: Can USA's rugby coach Mike Friday transform India’s U17 female rugby team?
programme.desc: Team USA coach Mike Friday travels to Mumbai to train the Indian U17 Rugby 7's women's side, aiming to qualify for the Youth Olympics.

programme.title: Lisa Klein ready to lead team Germany at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Breaking three world records and winning gold in Tokyo 2020, Lisa and team are now focusing on Paris 2024, aiming for another medal in the Women's Team Pursuit event.

programme.title: Jerry Tuwai: bringing hope from the slum to the nation
programme.desc: Jerry Tuwai grew up in a poor shanty in Fiji playing rugby with plastic bottles. He went on to win the first Olympic medal for his country.

programme.title: Men's 400m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 400m Freestyle Race was held on 27/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Lukas Maertens (GER) claimed Gold with a time of 3:41.78, Elijah Winnington (AUS) took Silver and Kim Woomin (KOR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 400m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 400m Freestyle Race was held on 27/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Ariarne Titmus (AUS) claimed Gold with a time of 3:57.49. Summer McIntosh (CAN) took Silver and Katie Ledecky (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 4x100m Freestyle Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x100m Freestyle Relay Final was held on 27/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. The United States of America claimed Gold with a time of 3:09.28, Australia took Silver and Italy completed the podium.

programme.title: Meet the young US swimmer who broke Michael Phelps’ record
programme.desc: Carson Foster is one the world’s fastest young swimmers. At the age of 10, he broke one of his idols records: Michael Phelps.

programme.title: Olympic State of Mind | Motivate yourself with Ariarne Titmus
programme.desc: The power of self-talk and music is all Australia’s swimming sensation, Ariarne Titmus, needs to motivate herself to get her going in her quest to reach the top.

programme.title: Ariarne Titmus: Splashing into swimming royalty | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How Ariarne Titmus went from chasing gold to being the one to beat after nail bitter 200m and 400m freestyle victories in Tokyo2020

programme.title: Samele (ITA) and Elsissy (EGY) - Men's Sabre Individual Bronze Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Individual Sabre Bronze Medal Bout between Luigi Samele (ITA) and Ziad Elsissy (EGY) took place on 27/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Samele (ITA) took the Bronze with a victory over Elsissy (EGY)

programme.title: Mallo-Breton (FRA) and Kong (HKG) - Women's Épée Individual Gold Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Épée Individual Gold Medal Bout between Auriane Mallo-Breton (FRA) and Man Wai Vivian Kong (HKG) took place on 27/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Mallo-Breton took the Silver,and Kong took the Gold.

programme.title: Matteo Zurloni Italy’s world champion climbs to the top | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Dive into the remarkable journey of Matteo Zurloni, from small town dreamer to Olympic contender. He won the speed event at the 2023 IFSC Climbing World Championships and earning a shot at Olympic glory. Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.title: Muhari (HUN) and Differt (EST) - Women's Épée Individual Bronze Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Épée Individual Bronze Medal Bout between Estzer Muhari (HUN) and Nelli Differt (EST) took place on 27/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Muhari (HUN) took the Bronze with a victory over Differt (EST)

programme.title: Oh (KOR) and Fares Ferjani (TUN) - Men's Sabre Individual Gold Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Sabre Individual Gold Metal Bout between Sanguk Oh (KOR) and Fares Ferjani (TUN) took place on 27/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Oh took the Gold.

programme.title: Majlinda Kelmendi at age 19
programme.desc: With judo star Majlinda Kelmendi back home in Kosovo when she was 19.

programme.title: Olympic Outposts -Episode 1: A global journey to discover sports passions in the most unlikely places.
programme.desc: Journey to the opposite ends of the world as our hosts explore the basketball fever in Philippines, American football in the heart of Germany or the unlikely Ice hockey tradition in Australia.
